column17: The attack took place in an unspecified city in Chad Territory.
column18: 09/03/2009: On Thursday, in Chadian territory, assailants kidnapped five representatives of Karbari Camp for Darfur refugees. The status of the hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility, although it was widely believed the Justice and Equality Movement (JEM) was responsible.
column39: Representatives of the Kabari Camp for Darfur refugees were the intended target.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.

column138: 11/10/2009: On Tuesday, in the village of Kawa near Adre, Ouadda�, Chad, assailants kidnapped a French agronomist working with the International Committee of the Red Cross and no material damage or casualties have been reported. The hostage was taken across the border to Sudan's troubled Darfur region and later released on 02/06/2010. The motive for the attack was to intensify border talks between Chad and Sudan. The group Faucons Libre d'Afrique (Free Falcons of Africa) claimed responsibility for the attack.

column17: The attack took place near Goz Beida, Ouaddai, Chad.
column18: 12/20/2009: On Sunday, near Goz Beida, Ouaddai, Chad, armed assailants attacked a United Nations (UN) convoy, firing upon and wounding one Integrated Security Detachment soldier and stealing one UN vehicle. No material damage or motive for the attack was reported and no group claimed responsibility, although it was widely believed the Union of Forces for Democracy and Development (UFDD) were responsible for the attack.
column58: Union of Forces for Democracy and Development (UFDD)
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: Unknown firearms were used in the attack.
column125: The most recent available sources listed the fatalities for this attack as zero, and the injuries for this attack from zero to one, so the majority casualty figures have been used in order to preserve statistical accuracy in the database. The assailants stole one United Nations vehicle during the attack.

column18: 6/6/2010: Unidentified assailants kidnapped an Oxfam worker from a restaurant near Abeche, Ouara department, Chad.  No group claimed responsibility for the incident and the specific motive is unknown.
